official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to allow an individual to elect a tax credit for 50 percent of his charitable contributions in lieu of the deduction allowed for such contributions.
short_title: Religious and Charitable Donors' Tax Credit Act

summary.text: Religious and Charitable Donors' Tax Credit Act - Allows an income tax credit under the Internal Revenue Code equal to 50 percent of the amount allowed as a charitable deduction up to a maximum credit of $500 ($1,000 in the case of a joint return). Disallows a claim of a tax deduction when such tax credit is claimed.
